channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-7577] Review names of all znodes in zk to make sure they are sensible before 0.96
item.description: HBASE-4451 was a rename we needed. My guess is we could do a few more now we have the opportunity (e.g. unassigned as name of dir for regions in transition..).
item.summary: Review names of all znodes in zk to make sure they are sensible before 0.96

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
My thought on balancer and master is that they could have more attributes than just address and on/off as time passes so I'd suggest those names are fine. Ditto for table. On the unassigned-region-state, its funny, but stuff in here could be unassigned for a short period of time but usually its transitioning to OPEN or CLOSED or its SPLITTING. transitioning is a mouthful though it goes w/ our regionInTransition that is all over the code base. Is 'moving' a better name? Or transit?

Good on you DD.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12565248/7577-1.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.TestMultiParallel
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.coprocessor.TestMasterCoprocessorExceptionWithAbort
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.TestAssignmentManager

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/4069//testReport/

Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/4069//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-examples.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/4069//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-hadoop-compat.html
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/4069//console

This message is automatically generated.
This should hopefully make the names clearer.
Yes, except for the "unassigned" string. Made it "region-transit-state". Please feel free to give it some other name if you think so..

This message is automatically generated.

Ok this turned out to be more involved than just changing one file.. There are literal strings referenced in many places that need to be changed to match the changes in the patch. These are the cause of some test failures. Will upload a patch soon.

Any reaction to the comments here DD: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HBASE-7577?focusedCommentId=13555868&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-13555868

Good on you.

Hey Stack, in the patch I uploaded, I had taken into account your comments. Have I missed something? I should update the patch with the fixes for the tests but I was busy trying to see if HBASE-3170 can be fixed.. I will update the patch with the test fixes soon but please let me know if I missed anything on the renaming part.

I think the only one to change is unassigned. Make it region-in-transition. Then it matches the code. The other changes I think are too specific as I see their content evolving over time: i.e. the master znode having more than just the address in it. Good on you DD.
I wonder how I misunderstood your comment on the names when I read it the first time. Sorry about that. This patch is in line with what you originally wanted.
